meanings.definition: A removable protective cover for the front of a machine or device.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic carefully removed the faceplate to access the inner components.
meanings.sent2: The faceplate of the computer was sleek and black, matching the overall design.
meanings.sent3: When the robot lost its faceplate, it looked like it had forgotten to wear its helmet!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a faceplate, hiding any hint of sadness underneath.
meanings.sent5: The faceplate shielded the delicate machinery from dust and debris.

meanings.definition: The front panel of a piece of electronic equipment.
meanings.sent1: The faceplate of the stereo system displayed the song title and volume.
meanings.sent2: He pressed the buttons on the faceplate of the DVD player to start the movie.
meanings.sent3: The faceplate of the TV remote seemed to have a mind of its own, changing channels randomly.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were fixed on the faceplate of the microwave, waiting for her popcorn to be ready.
meanings.sent5: The faceplate lit up with colorful lights, indicating the device was powered on.

meanings.definition: A metal plate attached to the front of a vehicle for decoration or protection.
meanings.sent1: The classic car had a shiny faceplate with intricate designs on the front.
meanings.sent2: He polished the faceplate of his motorcycle to make it gleam in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The faceplate of the truck was so reflective, it acted like a mirror for birds flying by.
meanings.sent4: The faceplate of the car was like a shield, deflecting bugs and debris on the highway.
meanings.sent5: The faceplate of the vehicle was engraved with the owner's initials for a personal touch.
